block.p: Darby Joyce Mullany and Richard Niccolo Dunn were married yesterday at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More in Manhattan.
The bride, 34, is a reporter for CNBC, the business-news cable television channel. The bridegroom, 29, is a producer for the CNBC program ''Squawk Box.''
Darby Joyce Mullany and Richard Niccolo Dunn were married yesterday at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More in Manhattan.
The bride, 34, is a reporter for CNBC, the business-news cable television channel. The bridegroom, 29, is a producer for the CNBC program ''Squawk Box.''

Ms. Mullany, who will keep her name, received a bachelor's degree in history and Italian from the University of Pennsylvania and a master's degree in journalism from Northwestern University. She is a daughter of Dr. Peter F. Mullany of Glen Rock, N.J., and the late Margaret Keane Mullany, who was an instructor in English literature at the College of New Rochelle. The bride's father is a professor of English at Fairleigh Dickinson University and an adjunct professor at Fordham University.

Mr. Dunn, who is known as Nick, received a bachelor's degree in political science from Rollins College. He is a son of Giovannella Gentile Dunn and Edward B. Dunn of Rye, N.Y. His father, a former managing director of Morgan Stanley Dean Witter, the Wall Street investment firm, is a commissioner of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority and the chairman of the board of Mercy College in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y. He was also the mayor of Rye from 1994 to 1997.

The bridegroom is a great-grandson of Giovanni Gentile, the pro-Fascist philosopher, who was from 1925 to 1937 the director of the Istituto della Enciclopedia Italiana, now Italy's largest cultural research body.
